result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Petition and Order for Funeral Pass, signed and filed. 
It is Hereby Ordered:
1. The petition is granted.
2. Security precautions are waived. The defendant shall be released no earlier than 9:45 a.m. on August 9, 2014, and no later than 10:00 a.m. on August 9, 2014 and shall return to home detention no later than 12:30 p.m. on August 9, 2014. This release allowed only for the Defendant to attend funeral at 4519 W. Villard as listed above. The Defendant may not visit any other location under this release authorization. 
The Defendant shall be monitored by GPS.
The defendant shall remain absolutely sober and comply with all rules of the Correctional Facility that is responsible for the defendant's custody. The Defendant shall not possess any firearm or dangerous weapon while released under this authorization. 
Copies sent to parties.
Request for Funeral pass forwarded to Branch 26 Judge Pocan.  jew

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  


The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring AFTER serving the first 2 months with Huber privileges.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:

*Court imposed and STAYED condition time of 20 days in the HOC, same release privileges as above, to be used by agent for violations.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Absolute sobriety.  
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant sworn.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  Court advised the defendant that he may no longer vote until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant picked up a new case. Case adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deangelo Brandon Carter in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
